categorical.reason: To understand the geographical distribution and origin of players.

numeric.reason: To understand the age profile of players and identify any unusual age entries.
To analyze the distribution of player ratings, which is a potential target variable, and identify top/bottom performers.
To understand the distribution of player potential ratings and identify promising talents.
To analyze the distribution of player market values, which is likely skewed, and identify high-value players and outliers. Also, to assess impact of missing values.
To analyze the distribution of player wages, which is likely skewed, and identify high-earners and outliers.

To understand player recruitment patterns over the years.

relationships.reason: To explore how player overall rating changes with age (e.g., peak performance age).
To understand the relationship between a player's skill rating and their market value.
To compare average overall ratings across different player positions.
To examine the relationship between a player's market value and their weekly wage.
To analyze how potential ratings are distributed across different age groups, identifying young talents.
To identify interdependencies and strength of relationships between key numeric attributes.
To analyze the distribution of contract end dates and identify potential trends in contract lengths or upcoming free agents.

recommended_visualizations.title: Distribution and Outliers of Player Market Value
Correlation Matrix of Key Numeric Attributes
Number of Players Joined Over Years

expected_insights: Distribution patterns and central tendencies of player attributes (e.g., age, overall rating, value).
Identification of top-performing players, most valuable players, and promising young talents.
Relationships and correlations between player attributes (e.g., how age affects overall rating, value vs. wage).
Impact of categorical features (e.g., Club, Nationality, Position) on player performance and value.
Patterns and extent of missing data, and potential strategies for imputation or handling.
Outliers and anomalies in financial data (Value, Wage, Release Clause) and physical attributes (Height, Weight).
Temporal trends related to player recruitment and contract durations.
Insights into player demographics and preferred playing styles (e.g., Preferred Foot, Skill Moves).
